alert.note: Alert for Central Cook; DuPage; Lake; Northern Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 6:51AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lake, northern DuPage and northwestern Cook Counties through 730 AM CDT... At 650 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of thunderstorm stretching from St. Charles to , or near St. Charles, moving to Richmond, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elgin, Waukegan, Arlington Heights, Evanston, Schaumburg, Palatine, Skokie, Des Plaines, Mount Prospect, Wheaton, Hoffman Estates, Glenview, Buffalo Grove, Bartlett, Ohare Airport, Streamwood, Carol Stream, Hanover Park, Wheeling and Park Ridge. Including the following interstates... I-90 between mile markers 58 and 80. I-94 between mile markers 1 and 39. I-290 between mile markers 1 and 10. I-294 between mile markers 1 and 39. I-355 between mile markers 29 and 30. This includes... Oakton Community College, Schaumburg Boomers Baseball, Chain O Lakes State Park, College of Lake County, Great Lakes Naval Training Center, Harper College, Lake County IL Fairgrounds, Lake Forest College, Northwestern University, Ravinia Music Festival, and Six Flags Great America. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for northeastern Illinois.

area.areaDesc: Central Cook; DuPage; Lake; Northern Cook
